intro: Lepechinia radula, commonly known as the rock lepechinia, is a perennial flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the mint family, Lamiaceae, and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. It has a compact growth habit and is well adapted to withstand drought conditions. Lepechinia radula is often found in open habitats such as sagebrush steppe and coastal dunes.
